meanings.definition: Animatisms: beliefs in supernatural beings or forces
meanings.sent1: Many ancient cultures had animatisms, believing in spirits that controlled nature.
meanings.sent2: The study of animatisms in different societies reveals diverse spiritual beliefs.
meanings.sent3: In a playful way, children sometimes create animatisms to explain mysterious events.
meanings.sent4: The animatisms of the forest whispered secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The animatisms of the wind seemed to dance through the trees, enchanting all who witnessed.

meanings.definition: Animatisms: actions or behaviors attributed to non-living objects or entities
meanings.sent1: Superstitions often involve animatisms, like thinking a broken mirror brings bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The belief in animatisms can lead people to assign personalities to inanimate objects.
meanings.sent3: The animatisms of the old car seemed to make it stubbornly refuse to start on Mondays.
meanings.sent4: The animatisms of the abandoned house gave it a haunted aura, scaring off potential buyers.
meanings.sent5: The animatisms of the clock made it seem like it was mocking him with its relentless ticking.
